org.mongodb.operation

Class MapReduceOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mongodb.operation.MapReduceOutput

  • public class MapReduceOutput
extends Object
    Specifies the location of the result of the map-reduce operation. You can output to a collection, output to a collection with an action, or output inline. You may output to a collection when performing map reduce operations on the primary members of the set; on secondary members you may only use the inline output.

    This class follows a builder pattern.


    MongoDB Doc Links
    • Out Options for Map-Reduce

      • sharded

        public MapReduceOutput sharded()
        Add a 'sharded' flag.

        If specified and you have enabled sharding on output database, the map-reduce operation will shard the output collection using the _id field as the shard key.

        Returns:
        the same MapReduceOutput instance as used for the method invocation for chaining

      • nonAtomic

        public MapReduceOutput nonAtomic()
        Add a 'nonAtomic' flag. Valid only together with Action.MERGE and Action.REDUCE

        If specified the post-processing step will prevent MongoDB from locking the database; however, other clients will be able to read intermediate states of the output collection. Otherwise the map reduce operation must lock the database during post-processing.

        Returns:
        the same MapReduceOutput instance as used for the method invocation for chaining
